NAME: Investment property
DESCRIPTION:
Investment property is property (land or a building—or part of a building— or both) held (by the owner or by the lessee as a right-of-use asset) to earn rentals or for capital appreciation or both, rather than for:
(a) use in the production or supply of goods or services or for administrative purposes; or
(b) sale in the ordinary course of business.
As defined by IAS 40.5

https://www.investopedia.com/terms/i/investment-property.asp:
An investment property is real estate property purchased with the intention of earning a return on the investment either through rental income, the future resale of the property, or both. The property may be held by an individual investor, a group of investors, or a corporation.
An investment property can be a long-term endeavor or a short-term investment. With the latter, investors will often engage in flipping, where real estate is bought, remodeled or renovated, and sold at a profit within a short time frame.
The term investment property may also be used to describe other assets an investor purchases for the sake of future appreciation such as art, securities, land, or other collectibles.

DESCRIPTION:
An Investor is a Party role where the Party invests in a position. 
Examples are the Investor in a Debt security position.
Please note that this definition also includes Investors as defined in Regulation (EU) 2402/2017, Article 2(11):
"'Investor' means a natural or legal person holding a securitisation position".

NAME: Investor
DESCRIPTION:
An Investor is a Party role where the Party invests in a position. 
Examples are the Investor in a Debt security position.
Please note that this definition also includes Investors as defined in Regulation (EU) 2402/2017, Article 2(11):
"'Investor' means a natural or legal person holding a securitisation position".

NAME: International securities identification number (ISIN) security
DESCRIPTION: An International securities identification number (ISIN) security is a Security that has a (registered) International securities identification number (ISIN).

NAME: International securities identification number (ISIN) security
DESCRIPTION: An International securities identification number (ISIN) security is a Security that has a (registered) International securities identification number (ISIN).

NAME: Issue-based rating system
DESCRIPTION: An Issue based rating system is a (Credit) Rating system that evaluates the creditworthiness of a borrower with respect to a particular debt or financial obligation.

NAME: Issue-based rating system
DESCRIPTION: An Issue based rating system is a (Credit) Rating system that evaluates the creditworthiness of a borrower with respect to a particular debt or financial obligation.

NAME: Issuer based rating system
DESCRIPTION: An Issuer based rating system is a (Credit) Rating system that quantifies the creditworthiness of a borrower in general terms.

NAME: Issuer based rating system
DESCRIPTION: An Issuer based rating system is a (Credit) Rating system that quantifies the creditworthiness of a borrower in general terms.

NAME: Issuer
DESCRIPTION: An Issuer is an Party role where the Party acts in the role of an Issuer (of Securities). For example a Securitisation special purpose entity (SSPE) issuing Asset-backed securities in the context of a Traditional securitisation, or a Credit institution issuing Debt securities.

NAME: Issuer
DESCRIPTION: An Issuer is an Party role where the Party acts in the role of an Issuer (of Securities). For example a Securitisation special purpose entity (SSPE) issuing Asset-backed securities in the context of a Traditional securitisation, or a Credit institution issuing Debt securities.

NAME: Joint venture (of the reporting agent)
DESCRIPTION: A Joint venture (of the reporting agent)  is an Other organisation role where the Other organisation is a joint arragnemetn whereby the parties (one of them being the Reporting agent) that have joint control of the arrangement have rights to the net assets of the arragement (see International Accounting Standard (IAS) 28: Investments in Associates and Joint Ventures (3)).

NAME: Joint venture (of the reporting agent)
DESCRIPTION: A Joint venture (of the reporting agent)  is an Other organisation role where the Other organisation is a joint arragnemetn whereby the parties (one of them being the Reporting agent) that have joint control of the arrangement have rights to the net assets of the arragement (see International Accounting Standard (IAS) 28: Investments in Associates and Joint Ventures (3)).

NAME: Risk position (Kb) per bucket derived data
DESCRIPTION:
The risk position for bucket b, K(b), must be determined by aggregating the weighted sensitivities to risk factors within the same bucket using the corresponding prescribed correlation ρ(kl)

KB per bucket is a term used in the standardised approach for market risk under FRTB. It is the risk capital requirement for a given bucket of risk factors within a risk class. It is computed as an aggregation of risk positions first at the bucket level, and then across buckets within a risk class defined for the sensitivities-based method.

A bucket is a set of risk factors that are grouped together by common characteristics (eg all tenors of interest rate curves for the same currency), as defined in MAR21.39 to MAR21.892. A risk position is the portion of the risk of an instrument that relates to a risk factor.

(https://www.bis.org/basel_framework/chapter/MAR/21.htm?inforce=20230101&published=20200327)

NAME: Key management personnel
DESCRIPTION: Key management personnel is a Natural person group role for those persons having authority and responsibility for planning, directing, and controlling the activities of the legal entity, directly or indirectly, including any directors (whether executive or otherwise) of the legal entity. DESCRIPTION: Key management personnel is a Natural person group role for those persons having authority and responsibility for planning, directing, and controlling the activities of the legal entity, directly or indirectly, including any directors (whether executive or otherwise) of the legal entity. NAME: Financial
DESCRIPTION: This cube provides information on the instrument's financial development. The data reported are the actual data reflecting the situation of the instrument at the reporting reference date. (Collection)

NAME: Accounting
DESCRIPTION: This cube provides information on the development of the instrument in accordance with the relevant accounting standard. (Collection)

NAME: Instrument
DESCRIPTION: This cube provides information on the instrument according with the definitions in the AnaCredit Regulation. (Collection)

NAME: Counterparty risk
DESCRIPTION: This cube provides information on the assessment of the counterparty's credit risk in accordance with the CRR. (Collection)

NAME: Joint liabilities
DESCRIPTION: This cube provides information on instruments with a plurality of debtors. The joint liabilities dataset is reported only for instruments which have a multiple debtors. (Collection)

NAME: Counterparty default
DESCRIPTION: This cube provides information that serves to identify the default status of the counterparty in accordance with Article 178 of the CRR. (Collection)

NAME: Protection received
DESCRIPTION: This cube provides information on the characteristics of any protection (both funded and unfunded) that serves to secure the repayment of instruments reported in the instrument dataset. For the purposes of AnaCredit data collection, protection received data comprise data on any kind of protection that is linked to any reported instrument via the instrument-protection received table. (Collection)

NAME: Counterparty-instrument
DESCRIPTION: This cube provides information on the counterparties that take on certain roles - the creditor to the instrument; the servicer to the instrument; the debtor to the instrument - vis-à-vis an instrument reported in the instrument dataset. (Collection)

NAME: Instrument-protection
DESCRIPTION: This cube provides information on the relationship between an instrument and a protection item that is used to secure this instrument. (Collection)

NAME: Axis
Cube
DESCRIPTION:
In essence: A Cube is a table. More specifically: A Cube is the Meta data description of a data
set in the dictionary. The possible data points of a cube (structure) may be
restricted to a specific area of this cube (structure) by listing all allowed /
non-allowed Combinations. A Cube can be either a Data Base table, a Data Flow
from the SDMX methodology, the underlying metadata information of an annotated
template of the Data Point Model or an entity of an Entity Relationship Model.

NAME: Table
Member
DESCRIPTION:
In a nutshell: Members define the allowed values of a
specific field (Variable) in the context of a table (or Cube). A Member is also
known as Code in a Code list. More
specifically: A Member is a concept
representing a possible value of an enumerated Domain. Examples for the Domain
of Country are Austria, Italy, Portugal or not applicable. Members are defined
on an enumerated Domain and can be organized in listed Subdomains. A hierarchy
of members can be described using Member hierarchies.

NAME: Domain
DESCRIPTION:
In a nutshell: A Domain is a container for the possible
allowed values of a field (Variable). More
specifically: Domains are, for example geographical areas or currencies. They
can be enumerated or non-enumerated. Enumerated domains are described by a set
of Members while non-enumerated domains are described by a Facet (constraint).
Please note that the members of an enumerated domain do not have to be disjoint
(i.e. they can partially overlap).

NAME: Variable
DESCRIPTION:
In a nutshell: A Variable is a concept in the dictionary and
is defined on a Domain. More
specifically: A Variable can be applied in different context;
it’s normally represented by a field in a Table. E.g. the Variable: Country can
be used in a table (Cube) referring to debtors (Country of the debtor) or in a
Cube referring to real estates (Country location of the real estate).

NAME: Subdomain
DESCRIPTION:
In a nutshell: A Subdomain defines the allowed values of a
certain field (Variable) in a table (Cube).  More specifically: A Subdomain is a
subset of a Domain to be applied in a certain context. Examples are the
countries of the European Union where the Euro is the official currency or the
currencies used in at least one of the countries of the European Union.

NAME: Framework
DESCRIPTION:
A Framework is a concept that comprises one-or-many Cubes. Examples are AnaCredit, BIRD, (non-reference) FinRep or (reference) FinRep.
The Cubes of a Framework may change over time, e.g. the evolution of BIRD.

NAME: Cube link
DESCRIPTION:
In
a nutshell: A Cube
link allows to find possible links between different tables (Cubes) in the
dictionary. More specifically: Normally Cube links are used to define the way
tables of different frameworks can be joined to integrate this data.

NAME: Table cell
Legal text
DESCRIPTION: A Legal text is a reference to a document.

NAME: Cube group
DESCRIPTION: A Cube group is a group of Cubes in the dictionary. It allows the organisation of Cubes in groups, independent on the Framework or Maintenance agency the Cubes belong to.

NAME: Member link
DESCRIPTION:
A Member link is a link between two Members in the respective subdomains of the Cube structure items linked in a Cube structure item link.
The linked Members are either the same Member or one is a parent (or ancestor) of the other one, in one Member hierarchy.

NAME: Combination
DESCRIPTION:
In a nutshell: A Combination can be a data point (DPM) or a
Series Key (SDMX). More
specifically: A Combination
is an object that represents a data point, following joint conditions on
multiple variables. It can also be an area of data points of one or more tables
(Cubes).

NAME: Member link
DESCRIPTION:
A Member link is a link between two Members in the respective subdomains of the Cube structure items linked in a Cube structure item link.
The linked Members are either the same Member or one is a parent (or ancestor) of the other one, in one Member hierarchy.

NAME: Variable set
DESCRIPTION:
In a nutshell: A Variable set is
similar to a Subdomain but it includes Variables instead of Members.

NAME: Cube mapping
DESCRIPTION: A Cube mapping is an object that allows to describe association between a target cube and a source cube.

NAME: Ordinate item
Axis ordinate
Cell position
Cube hierarchy
DESCRIPTION:
A Cube hierarchy is a hierarchical structure
(tree) of Cubes (tables). Cube hierarchies are also used to classify components
of a data model according to business classifications.

NAME: Cube structure
DESCRIPTION:
A Cube structure is the Meta data description of a data set. It consists of a set of Cube structure items representing the columns of a table, their roles (e.g. primary key) and the allowed values.
The implementation of a Cube structure as an intermediate between a Cube and the set of Cube structure items ensures compability of the dictionary with SDMX.

NAME: Transformation
DESCRIPTION: A Transformation is an expression that describes the manipulation of a data set where the result is again a data set.

NAME: Classification
Member mapping
DESCRIPTION: A Member mapping is an object that allows to organise a set of Member mapping items in the dictionary.

NAME: Legal reference
DESCRIPTION: A Legal reference is the combination of a dictionary element / object and a Legal text. Please note that the dictionary element / object is refered to via the combination of {Table identifier, Element identifier} and is therefore restricted to dictionary elements / objects having a primary key in the form of one field only.

NAME: Mapping to cube
DESCRIPTION: A Mapping to cube is a combination of a Cube mapping and a Mapping definiton in a specific time interval. It establishes the many-to-many relationship between Cube mappings and Mapping definitions.

NAME: Combination item
DESCRIPTION: A Combination item is a pair of {Variable, Member}, {Variable, Subdomain} or {Variable, VariableSet} that is a component of a Combination.

NAME: Variable mapping
DESCRIPTION: A Variable mapping is an object that allows to organise a set of Variable mapping items in the dictionary.

NAME: Member hierarchy
DESCRIPTION:
In a nutshell: A Member hierarchy represents one possible
hierarchical structure (tree) of Members in a Domain. More
specifically: There can be multiple Member hierarchies in a
Domain, one can represent the main hierarchical structure of a Domain while
others represent Framework or Subdomain-specific structures. An example is the
hierarchical structure of the countries of the European Union up to their
federated states.

NAME: Facet
DESCRIPTION:
In a nutshell: A
Facet describes the allowed values of a non-enumerated field. More
specifically: The facet type allows a (broad) categorization
of fields (Variables), e.g. Decimal, Integer, String or Gregorian day. Examples
are positive numbers (with a certain number of digits), strings (limited to a
certain number of characters), ISINs or dates (having a specific format).

NAME: Cube relationship
DESCRIPTION: A Cube relationship is a relationship between Cubes.

NAME: Cube relationship
DESCRIPTION: A Cube relationship is a relationship between Cubes.

NAME: Cube relationship
DESCRIPTION: A Cube relationship is a relationship between Cubes.

NAME: Facet item
DESCRIPTION: A Facet item or Facet enumeration is the combination of a Facet type and its value in the context of a Facet. It allows the definition of a specific feature of a Facet, e.g. setting the minimum / maximum value.

NAME: Maintenance agency
DESCRIPTION:
A Maintenance agency is the agency responsible for the maintenance of associated dictionary elements.
The concept of Maintenance agency allows the dictionary to manage different codification systems maintained by different Maintenance agencies.
We define the Maintenance agency SDD reference dictionary (ECB) as the reference Maintenance agency and refer to the dictionary elements associated with this Maintenance agency as reference objects or elements.

NAME: Mapping definition
DESCRIPTION:
In a nutshell: A
Mapping definition describes the translation of fields (Variables) and their allowed
values from a non-reference (original) codification system to the reference
(unified) codification system of the dictionary.

NAME: Combination mapping
DESCRIPTION: A combination mapping is an object that allows to describe association between a target combination and a source combination.

NAME: Framework hierarchy
DESCRIPTION: A Framework hierarchy is the combination of a Framework and a Cube hierarchy. It establishes the many-to-many relationship between Frameworks and Cube hierarchies.

NAME: Transformation node
DESCRIPTION: A Transformation node is a  component of a Transformation.

NAME: Member mapping item
DESCRIPTION: A Member mapping item is the combination of a Variable and a Member, the information if this Variable, Member combination acts as a source or a target and a row number in a specific time interval.

NAME: Cube structure item
DESCRIPTION:
A Cube structure item is the combination of a Variable (or column), its role and allowed values in the context of a Cube structure.
The role indicates if the variable acts as a dimension (i.e. part of the primary key), an observation (i.e. information related to the dimensions) or an attribute (i.e. information related to another variable in the same cube structure) in the context of this cube structure.

NAME: Cube hierarchy node
DESCRIPTION: A Cube hierarchy node is a node in a tree structure of a Cube hierarchy in a specific interval in time.

NAME: Framework subdomain
DESCRIPTION:
A Framework subdomain is the combination of a Framework and a Subdomain. It establishes the many-to-many relationship between Frameworks and Subdomains.
The justification of this relationship (between Frameworks and Subdomains) is that Subdomains may not only be used directly in the Framework (e.g. in a Cube structure item associated to the Framework) but also indirectly (e.g. a Subdomain that is used in the Transformations between Frameworks).

NAME: Cube to combination
DESCRIPTION: A Cube to combination is the combination of a Cube and a Combination. It establishes the many-to-many relationship between Cubes and Combinations.

NAME: Variable set mapping
DESCRIPTION: A Variable set mapping is an object that allows to map the metadata of a Variable set in the dictionary

NAME: Subdomain enumeration
DESCRIPTION: A Subdomain enumeration is the combination of a Subdomain and a Member for a specific time interval. It establishes the many-to-many relationship between Subdomains and Members.

NAME: Variable mapping item
DESCRIPTION: A Variable mapping item is the combination of a Variable and the information if this variable is a source or a target in a specific time interval.

NAME: Member hierarchy node
DESCRIPTION: A Member hierarchy node is a node in the tree structure of a Member Hierarchy in a specific interval in time.

NAME: Transformation scheme
DESCRIPTION: A Transformation scheme is an object that allows the organisation of Transformations. For example Transformations that are describe operations on the same initial data set.

NAME: Framework variable set
DESCRIPTION: A Framework variable set is the combination of a Framework and a Variable set. It establishes the many-to-many relationship between Frameworks and Variable sets.

NAME: Transformation to cube
Cube structure mapping
Cube group enumeration
DESCRIPTION: A Cube group enumeration is the combination of a Cube group and a Cube in a specific time interval. It establishes the many-to-many relationship between Cube groups and Cubes.

NAME: Cube structure item link
DESCRIPTION: A Cube structure item link is a link between two Cube structure items for a certain Cube link.

NAME: Variable set enumeration
DESCRIPTION: A Variable set enumeration is the combination of a Variable set, a Variable and a Subdomain for a specific interval in time. It establishes the many-to-many relationship between Variable sets and Variables.

NAME: Variable set mapping item
DESCRIPTION: A Variable set mapping item is an object that allows to map the metadata of a Variable set in the dictionary

NAME: Classification assignment
Transformation to variable
Cube structure mapping item
Logical transformation rule
Semantic transformation rule
